Generation I.Red: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.
Generation I.Yellow: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.
Generation I.Stadium: Capable of jumping over the Eiffel Tower in a single giant leap. Its hooves are ten times harder than diamonds.

Generation II.Gold: It is a weak runner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.
Generation II.Silver: Its hind legs, which have harder-than-diamond hooves, kick back at any presence it senses behind it.
Generation II.Crystal: Training by jumping over grass that grows longer every day has made it a world-class jumper.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It is a weak runner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its hind legs, which have harder-than-diamond hooves, kick back at any presence it senses behind it. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pok é mon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
Generation III.Sapphire: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pok é mon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
Generation III.Emerald: A Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. Its legs become stronger as it stumbles and falls while trying to keep up with its parent.
Generation III.FireRed: Its body is light, and its legs are incredibly powerful. It can clear Ayers Rock in one leap.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its hooves are ten times harder than diamond. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.

Generation IV.Diamond: About an hour after birth, its fiery mane and tail grow out, giving it an impressive appearance.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parent. It runs in fields and mountains all day.
Generation IV.Platinum: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It is a weak runner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its hind legs, which have hooves that are harder than diamond, kick back at any presence it senses behind it.

Generation V.Black: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
Generation V.White: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
Generation V.Black 2: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
Generation V.White 2: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

Generation VI.X: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
Generation VI.Y: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parent. It runs in fields and mountains all day.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.

Generation VIII.Sword: Its small horn hides a healing power. With a few rubs from this Pokémon's horn, any slight wound you have will be healed.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon will look into your eyes and read the contents of your heart. If it finds evil there, it promptly hides away.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: About an hour after birth, Ponyta's fiery mane and tail grow out, giving the Pokémon an impressive appearance.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parents. It runs all day in fields and on mountains.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: These Pokémon live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.
